messages.title: It's the Lib Dems or the Conservatives
messages.content: Fighting to save our countryside Martin Horwood has played a leading role in the fight to save our countryside and green spaces from over development.

messages.title: Martin delivers for Cheltenham
messages.content: Martin Horwood has been Cheltenham’s Liberal Democrat MP since 2005. He has fought post office closures and NHS cuts. In 2006 he supported the campaign to save Battledown children’s ward and was a leading voice in the campaign to save maternity services. He has fought Labour plans to get rid of Gloucestershire police and create one huge force. Martin campaigned to save rail services from Cheltenham to London which were threatened by Tory plans for a Parkway station near Gloucester.

keyPolicies.policyDescription: Martin Horwood won the backing of Cheltenham’s Green Party for his outstanding record on environmental issues. He has been fighting in Parliament since 2005 for tough action to tackle climate change and to protect our natural environment, both locally and around the world.
Cheltenham has suffered from Labour’s failure on the economy. Martin Horwood has a strong record of fighting for local jobs and businesses.
